website_summaries.verdict: An ability to hold a charge up to a year in storage make these great for backup power.
pros: Like similar top-quality batteries, these come factory charged and also offer good reliability
Batteries hold a charge for a long time, even when not in use
cons: Rare users question if the batteries were old stock, as they didn't last long once charged

customer_reviews.title: beware: Not all batteries at same capacity..
customer_reviews.text: The best i can (now) tell, Energizer does not sell a pack of four 2300mAh batteries... This supplier ships the 12 batteries as a pack of 8 and a pack of 4, so do not be surprised if you do not get 12 batteries of the same capacity.. if you mix these up..(and i received four 2000mAh batteries), you are limiting your devices to the lower capacity.. buy packs of 8 and elsewhere..
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Best Make and Model NiMH Batteries
customer_reviews.text: Best NiMH batteries at a reasonable price, if you're looking for quality, safe, long lasting rechargable batteries THESE are the ones you want. With how much batteries continue to cost, even in bulk, I thought it was worth the time to do my homework to find the most reliable and highest performing rechargeable..turns out Energizer makes them. A months worth of regular use and probably 20 charges in, these are still better than any other brand I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Penta

customer_reviews.title: Do not hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: These batteries were completely useless. They did not hold a charge at all. By the time I got to needing them, it was already too late for me to get a refund. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Hernandez.M

customer_reviews.title: Significantly longer life than compeditors
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Duracell version at first (a couple dozen) and was disappointed at the failure rate after just 3 months of use. After a year, only 3 or 4 were still charging and usable. I then gave the Energizers a chance and after a year of using a couple dozen of those in rotation, only one has failed and won't take a charge anymore. I don't like to bash a competitor, but if they want to keep up with Energizer on this front, they really need to go back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: SGI

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade for an older gadget
customer_reviews.text: I put these in an aging handheld VHF radio that needed new rechargeable batteries. Oddly, the charger for that radio would not work afterward. However, I soon realized that the additional capacity is such an improvement over the original that I could leave that radio on for a week without worrying about it. I bought a separate charger for these and am very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Stein

customer_reviews.title: Great batteries!
customer_reviews.text: I am loving these batteries! I have been using them exclusively in an external flash for my Nikon D90 camer (DSLR) and they have been lasting a nice amount of time. I was going through non-rechargeable batteries like crazy and these are great! They are decently quick to charge and hold their charge well from what I have seen so far. I would definitely recommend these batteries!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey HochstetterTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Best Value Ever
customer_reviews.text: I had to return to the Energizer AA Rechargeable batteries NiMH 2300 mAh 1.2V NH15 . These batteries have a 5 year life span. Stick with a brand that have been manufacturing batteries for decades! I purchased the AA EBL rechargeable 2,800 mAh. This was a poor decision. These batteries lose charge, in the span of a week, only after four (4) hours of use, on Sunday. The batteries registered so "low", on the battery indicator, that I had to recharge this every Sunday!
customer_reviews.author: PoliteTia

customer_reviews.title: They are great!!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why I always blew money on regular batteries... I use these in my remotes and my XBOX ONE controller. They are great!!

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy with the batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I'm wondering if these batteries are old. When they arrived there was only partial power in all of them. I charged and put them in the battery box. I got them out about two weeks later to use a few of them and they again needed to be charged. Why would they lose their charge in only a couple of weeks.....will this continue?

customer_reviews.author: Brody Hall

customer_reviews.title: Batteries are hard to find. These are pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing the lack of QUALITY choices for rechargeable AA batteries. Sure - there's plenty of generic batteries from China and elsewhere. But they won't last very long before they won't hold a charge and die. Energizers are a good reliable brand, I'm sure there's others out there that I haven't found yet, but until I do, -I'll keep buying these. Make sure to get the ones with the higher-quality, higher output 2300 mAh and not the lesser ones. Or you'll be sorry you did.
customer_reviews.author: Musicman

customer_reviews.title: Great Rechargeable Batteries
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used numerous rechargeable batteries and none have worked as effectively as the energizers. I’ve used Tenergy and it doesn’t maintain a charge for long. I can charge up the energizers, come back a week later and the charge doesn’t finish. Highly recommend.
